results.title: Making Chunky Move: C.O.R.R.U.P.T.E.D. 2
results.creator_credit: PAML, Erin Brannigan, Angharad Wynne-Jones and Peter Hennessey
results.brief_description: Making Chunky Move C.O.R.R.U.P.T.E.D. 2. is an exploration of how Chunky Move, one of Australia’s most exciting contemporary dance companies created this new dance work. It follows the company from the germ of an idea, to the stage, behind the scenes and beyond, with snapshot interviews with the key players, dancers, creative collaborators and other cultural identities as well as unique virtual 3D segments, sound bites and extensive footage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: PAML, Erin Brannigan, Angharad Wynne-Jones and Peter Hennessey
results.description: Making Chunky Move C.O.R.R.U.P.T.E.D. 2. is an exploration of how Chunky Move, one of Australia’s most exciting contemporary dance companies created this new dance work. It follows the company from the germ of an idea, to the stage, behind the scenes and beyond, with snapshot interviews with the key players, dancers, creative collaborators and other cultural identities as well as unique virtual 3D segments, sound bites and extensive footage.
description_for_label: Making Chunky Move C.O.R.R.U.P.T.E.D. 2. is an exploration of how Chunky Move, one of Australia’s most exciting contemporary dance companies created this new dance work. It follows the company from the germ of an idea, to the stage, behind the scenes and beyond, with snapshot interviews with the key players, dancers, creative collaborators and other cultural identities as well as unique virtual 3D segments, sound bites and extensive footage.

results.title: The Sky is Bluer
results.creator_credit: Nadine Samaha, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nadine Samaha left Lebanon in 1988 to escape the war but found a renewed love for her country through her daughter.

results.title: Where Do I Belong?
results.creator_credit: Rita el-Khoury, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Rita el-Khoury travels to Lebanon every year. She calls Australia and Lebanon her home but it wasn’t until she was caught in the middle of the 2006 Israeli bombing of Beiruit that she fully appreciated what that meant.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rita el-Khoury, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Rita el-Khoury travels to Lebanon every year. She calls Australia and Lebanon her home but it wasn’t until she was caught in the middle of the 2006 Israeli bombing of Beiruit that she fully appreciated what that meant.
description_for_label: Rita el-Khoury travels to Lebanon every year. She calls Australia and Lebanon her home but it wasn’t until she was caught in the middle of the 2006 Israeli bombing of Beiruit that she fully appreciated what that meant.

results.title: The Spaces in Between
results.creator_credit: Carla Pascoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Carla Pascoe traces her family’s ancestry from Lebanon and contemplates the mysterious circumstances of her great grandfather’s migration, as well as the undocumented moments of her family’s history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carla Pascoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Carla Pascoe traces her family’s ancestry from Lebanon and contemplates the mysterious circumstances of her great grandfather’s migration, as well as the undocumented moments of her family’s history.
description_for_label: Carla Pascoe traces her family’s ancestry from Lebanon and contemplates the mysterious circumstances of her great grandfather’s migration, as well as the undocumented moments of her family’s history.

results.title: Loving Lebanon and Australia
results.creator_credit: Sam Haddad, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Lebanese immigrant Sam Haddad migrated to Australia he encountered ignorance and racism but via a well timed punch, he learned the value of mateship and tolerance and began to love his adopted country.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Haddad, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When Lebanese immigrant Sam Haddad migrated to Australia he encountered ignorance and racism but via a well timed punch, he learned the value of mateship and tolerance and began to love his adopted country.
description_for_label: When Lebanese immigrant Sam Haddad migrated to Australia he encountered ignorance and racism but via a well timed punch, he learned the value of mateship and tolerance and began to love his adopted country.

results.title: Hyper-Ballad
results.creator_credit: Firas Massouh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Firas Massouh’s hunger for travel was started by his father who, as a communist activist, moved to Russia from Syria where he met his wife. With baby in tow, the family began a lifelong journey of travelling, which was continued by Firas when he decided to continue his father’s travels and move to Melbourne.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Firas Massouh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Firas Massouh’s hunger for travel was started by his father who, as a communist activist, moved to Russia from Syria where he met his wife. With baby in tow, the family began a lifelong journey of travelling, which was continued by Firas when he decided to continue his father’s travels and move to Melbourne.

With baby in tow, the family began a lifelong journey of travelling, which was continued by Firas when he decided to continue his father’s travels and move to Melbourne.

results.title: Hello Darling
results.creator_credit: Mike Helal, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Mike Helal left Lebanon at the height of the war and migrated to Melbourne. Reluctant to leave, Mike started to see the beauty of his new home. Despite this, nothing deters him as he waits to be reunited with his loved one again.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Helal, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Mike Helal left Lebanon at the height of the war and migrated to Melbourne. Reluctant to leave, Mike started to see the beauty of his new home. Despite this, nothing deters him as he waits to be reunited with his loved one again.
description_for_label: Mike Helal left Lebanon at the height of the war and migrated to Melbourne. Reluctant to leave, Mike started to see the beauty of his new home. Despite this, nothing deters him as he waits to be reunited with his loved one again.
